children.name: dlang.org
children.description: Official website for D.

children.name: wiki.dlang.org
children.description: Official Wiki for D.

children.name: code.dlang.org
children.description: Offical Library/Module Registry for D.

children.name: Github Organization
children.description: Official GitHub organization for D. Repo for all official D tools & code.

children.name: forum.dlang.org
children.description: Official forum. Many interesting discussions occurring on a daily basis.

children.name: Language Specification
children.description: D programming language specification.

children.name: Issue tracking
children.description: Official issue tracking/reporting system for D. If you find bugs in the D compiler and/or libraries, please come and report them!

children.name: Walter Bright
children.description: Father of D. Walter Bright is the creator and first implementer of the D programming language and has implemented compilers for several other languages.

children.name: Andrei Alexandrescu, PhD
children.description: C++ guru. Author of *The D Programming Language* and *Modern C++ Design*. With Walter Bright, Andrei co-designed many important features of D and authored a large part of D's standard library. Andrei works as a research scientist in Facebook and is now actively evangelizing D in the organization.

children.name: DConf
children.description: the premier event where D luminaries exchange knowledge, insight, and inspiration on everything related to the D language and its ecosystem.

children.name: D Programming Language
children.description: Official Organization, hosts DMD, Phobos and other official tools and libs.

children.name: Facebook
children.description: Facebook hosts a lot of libraries in many languages. Their contribution to D is the [warp](https://github.com/facebook/warp)--a preprocessor for C/C++ written in D, and [flint](https://github.com/facebook/flint)--an open-source lint program for C++.

children.name: DerelictOrg
children.description: A GitHub organization hosting all Derelict bindings including:

children.name: Circular Studios
children.description: We are a group of game developers at Rochester Institute of Technology building games and game tech. Hosts [Dash](https://github.com/Circular-Studios/Dash), a 3D game engine written in D, and other related libs.

children.name: d-gamedev-team
children.description: An organization of gamedev related repos, including a D gamedev toolkit called [gfm](https://github.com/d-gamedev-team/gfm) and an [opengl tutorial in D](https://github.com/d-gamedev-team/opengl-tutorials).

children.name: EMSI
children.description: A Career building company that uses D as their main language. Hosts their opensource projects.

children.name: infognition
children.description: Infognition is a self-funded and self-sustained company specializing in video processing and compression technologies for end-users and developers. They provide several opensource video related applications & tools written in D, hosted on [bitbucket](https://bitbucket.org/infognition). They are also porting their main product--[Video Enchanser](http://www.infognition.com/VideoEnhancer/) from C/C++ to D.

children.name: Books
children.description: D wiki page.

children.name: TDPL
children.description: The D Programming Language* by Andrei Alexandrescu.

children.name: Programming in D
children.description: A very detailed book about programming in D by Ali Çehreli  covering many areas of the language. Has a free online version and is suitable for beginners.

children.name: D Cookbook
children.description: A recipe-packed reference guide filled with practical tasks that are concisely explained to develop and broaden the user's abilities with the D programming language. by Adam D. Ruppe. Here is an interesting [review of the book](http://www.bfilipek.com/2014/08/review-of-d-cookbook.html).

children.name: Pragmatic D tutorial
children.description: This is a pragmatic introduction to the D Programming Language. by Andreas Zwinkau.

children.name: D Template Tutorial
children.description: A tutorial dedicated to D Templates. Very good explanation about templates. Has pdf version. by Philippe Sigaud.

children.name: Component programming in D
children.description: An article written by Walter Bright that details how D's functional support leads to a flexible and beautiful component programming style.

children.name: Component programming with ranges
children.description: A detailed blog post about how to do component programming in a idiomatic D way with ranges, with a full working example.

children.name: Functional image processing in D
children.description: A very interesting tutorial about writing an image processing lib in D. Shows the power of D's templates/CTFE/Ranges/UFCS for functional style programming.

children.name: OpenGL tutorials
children.description: OpenGL tutorials in D.

children.name: D Bare bones
children.description: kernel hello world in D (using GDC compiler)

children.name: D barebone with ldc2
children.description: another kernel hello world in D (using LDC compiler)

children.name: XOmB bare bones
children.description: an exokernel operating system written in D. [Main page](http://wiki.xomb.org/index.php?title=Main_Page), [github](https://github.com/xomboverlord/xomb/tree/unborn).

children.name: Bare Metal ARM Cortex-M GDC Cross Compiler
children.description: building a bare metal ARM Cortex-M (arm-none-eabi) GDC cross compiler for a Linux host.

children.name: Planet D
children.description: A repository of co-authored D-specific blogs maintained by Vladimir Panteleev.

children.name: D Idioms
children.description: A great blog for many useful idioms with D programming.

children.name: Purity in D
children.description: An article that explains the design principles behind D's purity feature.

children.name: Hidden treasures in the D standard library
children.description: An article talking about several useful functions and templates in Phobos.

children.name: Porting D Runtime to ARM
children.description: A study about porting a minimal D runtime to ARM Cortex-M preprocessors.

children.name: code.dlang.org
children.description: Official D library repository. Backed by dub.

children.name: dub
children.description: Official package and build management system for D.

children.name: dmd
children.description: The reference compiler for the D programming language. Stable, builds insanely fast, very good for learning and rapid prototyping/development. Currently the frontend is implemented in D, and shared between dmd, ldc and gdc, the backend is implemented in C++.

children.name: ldc
children.description: The LLVM-based D compiler. Uses the DMD frontend and LLVM backend. Builds slower than dmd, but generates more optimized code than DMD. It supports all the target platforms of LLVM.

children.name: gdc
children.description: GNU D Compiler. Use DMD frontend and GCC backend. Currently targets the most platforms due to the use of GCC. Generated code runs faster than DMD in most cases, on par with LDC. In the process of integration with the official GCC toolchain.

children.name: sdc
children.description: The Stupid D Compiler. Written in D. Grows Smarter every day.

children.name: dil
children.description: A compiler for the D programming language. Written in D.

children.name: dub
children.description: De facto official package and build management system for D. Will be included officially soon.

children.name: scons-d
children.description: Scons has built-in support for building D projects, thanks to Russel Winder.

children.name: Mono-D
children.description: A D language addon for [Xamarin Studio](http://xamarin.com/)/[MonoDevelop](http://monodevelop.com). With dub support.

children.name: Visual D
children.description: Visual Studio extension for the D programming language.

children.name: DDT
children.description: Eclipse plugin for the D programming language.

children.name: DCD
children.description: Independent auto-complete program for the D programming language. Could be used with editors like vim, emacs, sublime text, textadept, and zeus. See [editors support](https://github.com/Hackerpilot/DCD/tree/master/editors).

children.name: Coedit
children.description: Multiplatform IDE for the D programming language.

children.name: Dlang IDE
children.description: D language IDE based on [DlangUI](https://github.com/buggins/dlangui). This is a pure D implementation.

children.name: libdparse
children.description: A D language lexer and parser, (possibly) future standard D parser/lexer.

children.name: Martin Nowak's Lexer
children.description: A lexer generator.

children.name: Mono-D's DParser
children.description: A D parser written in C# and used in Mono-D.

children.name: Pegged
children.description: A Parsing Expression Grammar (PEG) module written in D.

children.name: Goldie
children.description: Goldie Parsing System.

children.name: ctpg
children.description: Compile-Time Parser (with converter) Generator written in D.

children.name: dunnart
children.description: LALR(1) Parser Generator written in D.

children.name: warp
children.description: A fast preprocessor for C and C++ used in Facebook infrastructure. Written by Walter Bright.

children.name: higgs
children.description: Higgs JavaScript Virtual Machine, implemented in D.

children.name: libasync
children.description: Cross-platform event loop library of asynchronous objects

children.name: libhttp2
children.description: HTTP/2 library in D, translated from nghttp2

children.name: vibe.d
children.description: Asynchronous I/O Web Framework that doesn’t get in your way, written in D.

children.name: arsd
children.description: Adam D. Ruppe's web framework.

children.name: cmsed
children.description: A component library for Vibe that functions as a CMS.

children.name: vibe.data.json
children.description: JSON functions in Vibe.d. Currently the best implementation I used.

children.name: fast.json
children.description: A library for D that aims to provide the fastest possible implementation of some every day routines.

children.name: std.json
children.description: D's standard library JSON module. Needs refinement.

children.name: dproto
children.description: Google Protocol Buffer support in D.

children.name: painlessjson
children.description: Convert between D types and std.json.

children.name: vibe.d
children.description: Vibe.d has internal support for Redis and MongoDB, which are very stable. Soon, the database drivers will be separated into independent projects.

children.name: mysql-native
children.description: A MySQL client implemented in native D.

children.name: ddb
children.description: Database access for D2. Currently only supports PostgreSQL.

children.name: arsd
children.description: Adam D. Ruppe's library; in addition to a Web backend, it also has support for database access with database.d, sqlite.d, mysql.d and postgres.d.

children.name: ddbc
children.description: DDBC is a DB Connector for D language (similar to JDBC). HibernateD (see below) uses ddbc for database abstraction.

children.name: hibernated
children.description: HibernateD is an ORM for D (similar to [Hibernate](http://hibernate.org/)).

children.name: dvorm
children.description: An ORM for D with Vibe support. Works with vibe.d and mysql-d, giving it the ability to access MongoDB and MySQL.

children.name: scriptlike
children.description: Utility library to aid writing script-like programs in D.

children.name: todod
children.description: Todod is a command line based todo list manager. It also has support for shell interaction based on [linenoise](https://github.com/antirez/linenoise).

children.name: d-colorize
children.description: A port of the ruby library [colorize](https://github.com/fazibear/colorize). It add some methods to set color, background color and text effect on console easier using ANSI escape sequences.

children.name: terminal.d
children.description: Part of Adam Ruppe's [arsd](https://github.com/adamdruppe/arsd) library supporting cursor and color manipulation on the console.

children.name: GtkD
children.description: GtkD is a D binding and OO wrapper of GTK+. GtkD is actively maintained and is currently the most stable GUI lib for D.

children.name: DWT
children.description: A library for creating cross-platform GUI applications. GWT is a port of the Java SWT library to D.

children.name: tkD
children.description: GUI toolkit for the D programming language based on Tcl/Tk.

children.name: DLangUI
children.description: Cross Platform GUI for D programming language.

children.name: cobox-wm
children.description: CteamBox Window Manager in D programming Language

children.name: wiki.dlang.org
children.description: but not all of the libraries are actively maintained now.

children.name: DerelictOrg
children.description: A GitHub organization hosting all Derelict bindings including:

children.name: DGame
children.description: A 2D framework for the D programming Language. see <http://dgame-dev.de/>.

children.name: gfm
children.description: D gamedev toolkit. see <http://d-gamedev-team.github.io/gfm/>.

children.name: Dash
children.description: A free and open 3D game engine written in D. see <http://circularstudios.com/dash>.

children.name: DSFML
children.description: A static binding of SFML in a way that makes sense for D. see <http://dsfml.com/>.

children.name: Spacecraft
children.description: A 3d multiplayer deathmatch space game written in D 2.0.

children.name: ArmageddonEngine
children.description: Vladimir Panteleev's ae library has a package for image processing in functional style, which is described in the article [Functional Image Processing in D](http://blog.thecybershadow.net/2014/03/21/functional-image-processing-in-d/).

children.name: Blogsort
children.description: A simple Windows app for viewing photos and preparing them for a blog.

children.name: scid
children.description: Scientific library for the D programming language

children.name: logger
children.description: Phobos logger proposal.

children.name: dlogg
children.description: Logging for concurrent applications and daemons with lazy and delayed logging, [logrotate](http://linuxcommand.org/man_pages/logrotate8.html) support.

children.name: sdlang
children.description: An SDL (Simple Declarative Language) library for D.

children.name: D:YAML
children.description: YAML parser and emitter for the D programming language.

children.name: mood
children.description: simple vibe.d based blog engine
